STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 20, 2023
FRANCISCO GONZALEZ
BETHANY CHRISTIAN SERVICES INC-RESIDENTIAL
901 EASTERN AVE,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49503-1201
Re: License #: CI410200975
Investigation #: 2023C0000769SI
Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI410200975
Licensee Group Organization: Bethany Christian Services Inc
Licensee Designee: George Tyndall
Chief Administrator: FRANCISCO GONZALEZ
Agency Name: BETHANY CHRISTIAN SERVICES INC-
RESIDENTIAL
Agency Address: 901 EASTERN AVE
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49503-1201
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/24/2024
Capacity: 41
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
9/18/2023 10:05 AM Onsite Inspection Unannounced Visit; Special
Investigation Initiation; Interview
9/18/2023 1:28 PM Email Documentation received or sent
9/27/2023 1:00 PM Face to Face Announced Visit; Interview
9/27/2023 1:25 PM Phone Interview
9/27/2023 1:48 PM Face to Face Interview
9/27/2023 2:45 PM Face to Face Interview
9/27/2023 2:57 PM Face to Face Interview
9/27/2023 3:12 PM Face to Face Interview
9/27/2023 4:27 PM Phone Interview
9/27/2023 8:25 PM Email Other
10/2/2023 1:00 PM Phone Interview
10/2/2023 2:10 PM Email Other
1

10/2/2023 2:40 PM Email Documentation received or sent
10/3/2023 3:33 PM Phone Interview

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/6/23, staff member pushed youth in the kitchen at the facility
and stated that if they were outside, staff member would shoot
youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 9/18/23. Supervisor 1 reported she heard the
allegations from Supervisor 2. Supervisor 1 reported she spoke
with Staff 3 about the allegations on 9/14/23 and Staff 3 admitted
to pushing Youth A backwards and telling Youth A to “never do
that again” in reference to Youth A scaring him. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 3 also laughed and said, “I would never shoot him”.
Supervisor 1 reported she reviewed video footage and then called
in a complaint. Supervisor 1 reported she didn’t talk directly to
Youth A about the situation. Supervisor 1 told Staff 3 on 9/15/23
he was on leave until further notice. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 3
used to be a youth at the facility and sometimes can show a lack
of professionalism. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 3 seems aware of
his own triggers and responses, but sometimes can be aggressive
in his verbal tone towards youth.
2

Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 9/29/23. Supervisor
2 reported Staff 1 told him Youth A disclosed to her about Staff 3
threatening to “shoot” Youth A. Supervisor 2 did not speak with
Staff 3 or Youth A directly about the allegations. Supervisor 2
reported Staff 3 can be a “hot head”. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 3
can be disrespectful to the youth in the home and antagonizes the
youth if they separate themselves from him as he will continue to
follow them.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 9/27/23. Staff 1 reported
she was driving Youth A to school one day (couldn’t remember
which day) and Youth A nonchalantly reported Staff 3 stated he
was going to shoot him. Staff 1 reported she told Youth A “don’t
joke like that, it’s not funny” and Youth A assured her he wasn’t
joking. Staff 1 reported she told Supervisor 2 about the situation
and Supervisor 2 instructed her to follow-up and get more details
when Youth A was home from school. Staff 1 spoke with Youth A
later that day and Youth A told her he was walking into the kitchen
and jokingly scared Staff 3. Youth A told Staff 1, Staff 3 turned
around and told him “You know if we were outside, I would have
shot you”. Staff 1 reported she was unaware Staff 3 pushed Youth
A. Staff 1 reported there have been a few times when she’s been
concerned with Staff 3’s interactions with the youth because some
of the things he says are insulting or unprofessional and are things
an adult in this role should never say to a child. Staff 1 reported
she has never witnessed Staff 3 be verbally or aggressive towards
any youth. Staff 1 reported since March/April 2023, whenever
she’s seen Staff 3 on the schedule, she knows it’s going to be a
rough afternoon. Staff 1 reported Staff 3’s behavior hasn’t
improved since then and it seems like Staff 3 hates his job, so he
takes it out on the youth. Staff 1 reported she has expressed
these concerns to Supervisor 2 before and she believes they’ve
been addressed.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/27/23.
Staff 2 reported she did not witness the incident. Staff 2 reported
she was driving Youth A to work one day (not sure which day) and
Youth A was talking about his disdain for Staff 3. Staff 2 reported
Youth A said Staff 3 pushed him. Staff 2 asked Youth A if it was
funny banter or something serious and Youth A said it was
serious. Staff 2 reported Youth A told her he went in the kitchen to
spook Staff 3 to be funny. Youth A reported Staff 3 turned around
and said, “if this happened on the streets, I would shoot you” and
then Staff 3 pushed Youth A. Staff 2 encouraged Youth A to speak
to Supervisor 1 about the situation, but he didn’t seem like he
wanted to, so Staff 2 reported it to Supervisor 1 instead. Staff 2
3

reported once or twice Staff 3 has cussed in front of the youth,
which she doesn’t feel is professional, but she hasn’t seen any
other inappropriate interactions.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/27/23.
Staff 3 reported he was cooking for youth and staff when Youth A
came up behind him, touched him and yelled. Staff 3 reported he
was frightened, and in response, he pushed Youth A with little to
no force and said, “get away from me, I don’t like this stuff”. Staff 3
reported he pushed Youth A to create space between them
because Staff 3 was in a corner. Staff 3 reported he couldn’t
remember what else either of them said to each other. He
reported he never told Youth A he was going to shoot him. He
reported the youth sometimes do some inappropriate things when
they’re in the community (i.e., cat calling women on the street,
flipping middle fingers at cars driving by, etc.) and one time he told
all the youth “This is America and you never know who has a gun,
so if you keep acting that way, you might get shot”. He reported he
said this out of concern for their safety and ensuring they
understood the realities of living in America. He said he couldn’t
remember when he said it, but it wasn’t the day of the incident.
Staff 3 reported he could have removed himself from the situation
with Youth A, but he was focused on cooking and wanted to finish.
Staff 3 reported he has told the youth many times to not get close
to him, not to touch him and requested they respect his personal
bubble, but they don’t listen. Staff 3 reported he feels he is
generally not respected by some of the youth, which could be a
rapport issue, and he’s trying to fix it. Staff 3 reported some of the
youth comment negatively on his height, his hand size, and his
body, which are signs of disrespect to him. Staff 3 reported he
tries to correct them, but they don’t want to be corrected. Staff 3
reported he has never had any verbal or physical altercations or
confrontations with other youth before.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/27/23.
Staff 4 reported he was working with Staff 3 on 9/6/23 when the
incident occurred, but he did not see or hear what happened
between Youth A and Staff 3. Staff 4 reported Staff 3 told him after
the interaction Staff 3 pushed Youth A because Youth A scared
him.
Interpreter was interviewed face to face at the facility on
9/27/23. Interpreter was in the kitchen at the time of the incident
and saw Youth A scare Staff 3. Interpreter reported he saw Staff 3
push Youth A, but felt it was a natural reaction from being scared.
Interpreter reported he could not tell if the push was serious or
4

playful in nature. Interpreter reported he could not remember
anything Youth A or Staff 3 said during the interaction. Interpreter
reported he did not hear Staff 3 say anything about shooting
Youth A, but admitted he was not paying close attention.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/27/23.
Youth A reported on 9/6/23, he went into the kitchen while Staff 3
was cooking. He went next to Staff 3 and made a loud noise to
jokingly scare Staff 3. Youth A reported Staff 3 turned around and
pushed him. Then after a minute or so, Staff 3 said “If you were
outside, I would have shot you with a gun”. Youth A reported Staff
3 was very aggressive and was serious when he pushed Youth A
and talked about shooting him. Youth A reported he felt insecure
and unsafe with Staff 3 during and after the interaction. Youth A
reported there have been multiple situations when Staff 3 has
been verbally aggressive towards youth in the home by yelling or
cussing at them, but he hasn’t seen Staff 3 be physical with any
other youth.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage of 9/6/23 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video footage does not have any audio. It should also be noted
Youth B is in the kitchen during the incident; however, he is facing
away from the incident and has his headphones in. Therefore, he
was not interviewed.
Staff 3 is standing in front of the oven in the kitchen facing the
wall. Interpreter is standing in front of the refrigerator, which is
located behind Staff 3’s position. Youth A is seen walking through
the milieu and entering the kitchen. He walks past Interpreter and
approaches Staff 3. Staff 3 turns around quickly and faces Youth
A. They exchange words and then after a few seconds, Staff 3
uses his right hand, puts it on Youth A’s chest and forcefully
shoves Youth A backwards. Staff 3 then walks to the refrigerator
and Youth A is seen behind him talking to him. Staff 3 turns
around and exchanges words with Youth A. While they’re
exchanging words, Staff 4 enters the kitchen and begins speaking
to them. Staff 3 then resumes cooking at the stove.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Bethany Employee Handbook states physical or verbal
harassment, violence, abuse, threats, or intimidation are
prohibited.
5

• Bethany Christian Services Emergency Restraint Policy
and Procedures states pushing a youth on any part of their
body and threats towards youth are prohibited.
• Facility Incident report states Youth A notified Staff 1 of the
allegations, who then told Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 notes
she spoke with Staff 3, who admitted to pushing Youth A.
• Bethany Christian Services Safety Plan regarding Staff 3
dated 9/20/23 states the purpose is to identify steps for
immediate and ongoing coaching and development of Staff
3 to reinforce expectations and promote active
implementation of appropriate boundaries, conversation,
and professionalism related to interactions with clients.
• Staff 3 has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. He has one performance
coaching document in his file related to this investigation
dated 9/30/23. Staff 3 completed CPI training on 6/7/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage reviewed, and
documentation reviewed there is evidence to show Staff 3 pushed
Youth A during an interaction in the kitchen of the facility on
9/6/23.
There is no evidence to support Staff 3 threatened to shoot Youth
A. Staff 3 reported in a separate interaction on a separate date
involving multiple youth, he warned them not to act in certain ways
in public because they don’t know who has a gun and might shoot
them. Staff 3 reported he never stated he or anyone from the
facility would shoot any of the youth and was simply stating a
general warning of concern for youth safety in the community.
Youth A maintains Staff 3 threatened to shoot him. However, none
of the other witnesses to the verbal interaction on 9/6/23 can
confirm what was or wasn’t said.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
6

Allegation Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not stop a fight between two youth at the
facility.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 9/29/23. Supervisor
2 reported there was an altercation between Youth B and Youth C
on 9/6/23. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 3 watched the fight between
the two youth and never tried to intervene or separate them.
Supervisor 2 reported Staff 4 attempted to intervene and separate
them but was unable to without assistance. Supervisor 2 reported
other youth in the facility ultimately split up Youth B and Youth C.
Supervisor 2 reported after the two youth were separated, they
ended up engaging in a second fight and, once again, Staff 3
failed to intervene.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 10/2/23. Supervisor
1 reported she was not present, but she has incident reports of the
altercation between Youth B and Youth C on 9/6/23. Supervisor
reported Staff 3 did not intervene in the fight. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 4 attempted to intervene but was unsuccessful.
Supervisor 1 reported she spoke with Staff 3 and Staff 4 about
taking action when needed because they are CPI trained and
need to utilize CPI techniques. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 3 did
not take ownership of his lack of action but was receptive to
feedback. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 3 stated “yeah, I
understand. I was in a bad headspace that day and I realize I
should have done something, but I can’t take it back”. Supervisor
1 reported Staff 3 also stated “Well [Youth C] was talking smack
and kind of deserved it”. Supervisor 1 reported she provided the
information regarding the incident to Human Resources, and they
did not do anything further because they were going to combine
all concerns on 9/6/23 in the same written warning and were
waiting for this investigation to be completed prior to proceeding.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 10/3/23. Staff 3 reported
Youth B and Youth C were fighting and choking each other. Staff
3 reported his mindset was “okay let them finish this fight really
quick, and if they don’t stop after a minute, I’ll call the police”. Staff
3 reported Staff 4 attempted to help by separating them, but it
didn’t work. Staff 3 reported between him and Staff 4, they
wouldn’t have been able to do anything because Youth B and
Youth C were stronger and taller than them. Staff 3 reported he
has never used CPI before, but he has been trained in CPI; most
recently in June 2023. Staff 3 reported he practiced the restraint
and de-escalation skills during training but doesn’t feel
comfortable using them. Staff 3 reported training once per year for
a few hours is not enough time or frequency to maintain learning
7

the skills when they’re not used often. Staff 3 stated “I just work
here. I don’t want to get hurt or accidently hurt someone else. I
feel it’s completely justified not to put my hands on someone else.
I have no intention of using CPI restraints unless necessary and I
didn’t feel it was necessary”. Staff 3 reported he felt CPI wouldn’t
suffice in the situation, so he yelled “I’m going to call the police”
loudly and then they stopped fighting. Staff 3 reported the situation
was very dangerous and he felt Youth B nor Youth C would be in
the mindset to be separated. Staff 3 reported once the boys were
separated the first time, he wasn’t thinking, so he didn’t attempt to
get any of the youth to leave the scene. Staff 3 reported if he
could change one thing about his actions, he would have cleared
the scene when the first fight was over.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 10/4/23. Staff 4 reported
Youth B and Youth C ran out of the house and began physically
fighting on the lawn. Staff 4 reported he tried to break them up, but
Staff 3 made no attempt to help. Staff 4 reported he was
unsuccessful in breaking up the fight because the two youth kept
fighting by slapping each other. Staff 4 reported had Staff 3
contained one youth and Staff 4 contained the other youth, they
could have separated them easily. Staff 4 reported when he asked
Staff 3 to get one of the youth, Staff 3 replied he didn’t want to be
involved. Staff 4 reported after he was unsuccessful in separating
Youth B and Youth C, other youth jumped in and helped pull them
apart, which Staff 4 was thankful for. Staff 4 reported he felt alone
in the situation. Staff 4 reported he was trying to de-escalate
Youth B and Youth C the entire time by asking them to stop and
explaining why it wasn’t okay. Staff 4 reported Staff 3 repeated
“stop fighting” but that was all he said to attempt to de-escalate
the situation.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Video footage of 9/6/23 directly outside of the facility was
reviewed. It should be noted the video footage does not have any
audio. Youth B and Youth C exit the facility, with Staff 3, Staff 4
and the other youth behind them. Youth B and Youth C begin
physically fighting with each other outside of the facility. Staff 4
walks towards them slowly and then tries to intervene by putting
himself in between them. When that doesn’t work, he backs off
and watches with his hands in his pockets. Youth D and another
youth (can’t tell from the camera who due to it being dark, so
identified as Unknown Youth) separate Youth B and Youth C.
Staff 3 watches and makes no effort to intervene or separate the
youth. Youth C, Youth D, Staff 3, Staff 4, and the rest of the youth
stand in a group conversing, while Youth B struggles to get away
8

from Unknown Youth’s hold on him. Finally, after Youth B and
Unknown Youth walk around a bit, Youth B is released, and they
begin walking towards the group. Youth B begins to head towards
Youth C and Staff 4 steps in front of him and puts his hand on
Youth C’s chest to block him from moving forward. They begin to
walk side by side towards the door to enter the facility. Then Youth
C goes behind Staff 3, comes around Staff 3’s left side and
punches Youth B. Staff 4 tries to grab onto Youth B or Youth C,
but the momentum of them fighting caused Staff 4 to be
unsuccessful. Youth B and Youth C continue to fight while
everyone, including Staff 3 and Staff 4, watch. Youth B and Youth
C are on the ground fighting and the camera angle is blocked by
some trees/shrubbery, so you can only see everyone watching
them fight. Staff 4 finally bends down to their level. Youth B and
Youth C both get up and separate. Staff 4 stands in front of Youth
C in attempts to block him from going after Youth B again. Youth
C avoids him and begins to jog around the group. Staff 4 then
stands in front of Youth B and faces Youth C to attempt to stop
further altercations. As Youth C continues to jog around, Staff 4
continues to change his angle, so he is always in between Youth
B and Youth C. Then everyone re-enters the facility.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident Report dated 9/6/23 authored by Supervisor 1
titled “Assault toward a peer” outlines what happened prior
to Youth B and Youth C going outside to fight. Incident
report notes “Many other clients witnessed the fight and two
clients intervened by pulling [Youth B] and [Youth C] off
each other. [Staff 3] and [Staff 4] were present, however,
were not engaging in physical interventions, but attempted
to verbally de-escalate the situation”.
• Bethany Christian Servies Emergency Restraint Policy and
Procedures states physical intervention should only be
used after de-escalation has been attempted and for the
following reasons: prevent serious injury to resident,
prevent injury to other and prevent escape where resident
may be at risk of injury to others.
• Bethany Christian Services TLC Policy and Procedure:
Staff Conduct and Expectations states staff shall follow all
safety rules and practices.
• Bethany Employee Handbook states failing or neglecting
essential duties, client management rules and procedures,
or company policies are prohibited.
9

• Bethany Christian Services Safety Plan regarding Staff 3
dated 9/20/23 states the purpose is to identify steps for
immediate and ongoing coaching and development of Staff
3 to reinforce expectations and promote active
implementation of appropriate boundaries, conversation,
and professionalism related to interactions with clients.
• Staff 3 has one disciplinary record in his employee file
unrelated to this investigation. He has one performance
coaching document in his file related to this investigation
dated 9/30/23. Staff 3 completed CPI training on 6/7/23.
• Staff 4 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 4 completed CPI training on 6/7/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, documentation reviewed, and
video footage reviewed, this violation is established. Staff 3 and
Staff 4 watched Youth B and Youth C fight and did not properly
intervene as they did not utilize their training in CPI to keep Youth
B and Youth C from hurting each other.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0103011 dated 4/29/22; CAP approved 5/18/22
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4128 Initial staff training and ongoing training
Section (5) An employee shall not participate in restraining a resident or
Description placing a resident in seclusion prior to receiving training on those
topics. The training model shall be approved, in writing, by the
department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Facility has been utilizing and training staff on a restraint policy not
approved by the Department.
Investigation During review of the restraint policy Supervisor sent to Consultant,
it was discovered the policy was not most recent policy approved
by DCWL in July 2022. When asked, Supervisor reported the
approved policy was sent to staff on 7/11/22 and a team meeting
was held the same month to train staff on the policy. However, the
policy was never put into their shared drive. Therefore, all staff
hired after the email was sent and the training occurred, have
been trained on old policy. In addition, the old policy was the only
one staff had access to in order to refresh their skills on an
ongoing basis.
10

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Bethany Christian Servies TLC Policy and Procedure:
Physical Restraints (rev. 9/12/23) is the policy old. It was
revised by the facility’s quality assurance team in
September 2023 because it was still located in the facility’s
shared drive.
• Bethany Christian Services Emergency Physical Restraint
Policy and Procedures (rev. 8/10/22) is the policy approved
by the Department.
Analysis Based on documentation reviewed and information received from
Supervisor, this violation is established. The facility has been
training staff and operating based on an outdate restraint policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
October 19, 2023
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 20, 2023
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
11
